CHEM CS 5.title: Group Studies
CHEM CS 5.description: Student-directed discussion and study in a variety of subjects within Chemistry & Biochemistry.

CHEM CS 11A.title: CCS General Chemistry
CHEM CS 11A.prereq_description: Consent of instructor required for non-majors.
CHEM CS 11A.comments:
Designed for majors. Quarters usually offered: Fall.
Repeat Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Chemistry 1A or 2A.
CHEM CS 11A.description: The sequence of topics will be similar to that in Chemistry 1A. Calculus will be used as needed, at the level of the concurrent MATH 3A course.
CHEM CS 11A.recommended_prep: High school algebra, chemistry, and physics.

CHEM CS 11B.title: CCS General Chemistry
CHEM CS 11B.prereq_description: Consent of instructor for non-majors. CHEM 1A or CHEM 2A, or a Pass with a minimum of 3.0 units earned in CHEM CS 11A.
CHEM CS 11B.comments:
Designed for majors. Quarters usually offered: Winter.
Repeat Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Chemistry 1B or 2B.
CHEM CS 11B.description: The sequence of topics will be similar to that in Chemistry 1B. Calculus will be used as needed, at the level of the concurrent MATH 3B course.
CHEM CS 11B.recommended_prep: High school algebra, chemistry, and physics, and one quarter of calculus.

CHEM CS 11C.title: CCS General Chemistry
CHEM CS 11C.prereq_description: Consent of instructor for non-majors. CHEM 1B or CHEM 2B, or a Pass with a minimum of 3.0 units earned in CHEM CS 11B.
CHEM CS 11C.comments:
Quarters usually offered: Spring.
Repeat Comments: Not open for credit to students who have completed Chemistry 1C or 2C.
CHEM CS 11C.description: The sequence of topics will be similar to that in Chemistry 1C. Calculus will be used as needed, at the level of preceding MATH 3A and 3B courses.
CHEM CS 11C.recommended_prep: High school algebra, chemistry, and physics, and two quarters of calculus.

CHEM CS 103.title: Seminar
CHEM CS 103.comments: May be taken as often as once each quarter.
CHEM CS 103.description: Presentation and critical discussion of topics in chemistry.

CHEM CS 110.title: Introduction to the Chemical Applications of Group Theory
CHEM CS 110.prereq_description: Chem 1A, 1B, or 2A, 2B.  Concurrent enrollment in Chem 1C or 2C. Consent of instructor; creative studies majors only.
CHEM CS 110.description: The mathematics of group theory is introduced.  Point groups and symmetry operations will be applied toward the normal coordinate analysis of molecular vibrations and the construction of molecular orbitals from symmetry adapted linear combinations of atomic orbitals.

CHEM CS 199.title: Independent Studies
CHEM CS 199.comments: May be repeated for credit. Creative Studies students may enroll in a maximum of 24 units of Independent Studies courses per year, with a maximum of 45 units counted toward graduation.
CHEM CS 199.description: Serious independent study in chemistry with consenting faculty member.
